problem_text: This is a GeomVerse problem. If the arc length of the ABC sector is 23.13 and the diagonal of the BDEC square is 18, compute the degree of the CBA angle. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.patches as patches
import numpy as np

# Coordinates
A = (12377.519999999999, -3071.13)
B = (34.23, 34.23)
C = (34.23, 12762.15)
D = (-12693.69, 34.23)
E = (-12693.69, 12762.15)

# Create figure and axis
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 8))

# Draw the yellow arc sector (B, A, C)
radius = 12762.15
start_angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(A[1] - B[1], A[0] - B[0]))
end_angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(C[1] - B[1], C[0] - B[0]))

if start_angle > end_angle:
    end_angle += 360

arc = patches.Wedge(
    center=B,
    r=radius,
    theta1=start_angle,
    theta2=end_angle,
    facecolor="yellow",
    edgecolor="black",
    alpha=0.6
)
ax.add_patch(arc)

# Draw the brown rectangle (B, D, E, C)
brown_rectangle = patches.Polygon([B, D, E, C], closed=True, color="brown", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(brown_rectangle)

# Draw right-angle markers
def draw_right_angle(ax, p1, p2, p3, size=0.5, color="gray", alpha=0.8):
    '''Draw a right-angle marker at the corner defined by p1, p2, and p3.'''
    v1 = np.array(p1) - np.array(p2)
    v2 = np.array(p3) - np.array(p2)
    v1 = v1 / np.linalg.norm(v1) * size
    v2 = v2 / np.linalg.norm(v2) * size
    marker = patches.Polygon(
        [p2, p2 + v1, p2 + v1 + v2, p2 + v2],
        closed=True,
        facecolor=color,
        edgecolor=None,
        alpha=alpha
    )
    ax.add_patch(marker)

# Add right-angle markers
draw_right_angle(ax, B, D, E)
draw_right_angle(ax, D, E, C)
draw_right_angle(ax, E, C, B)
draw_right_angle(ax, C, B, D)

# Add labels
ax.text(A[0], A[1], "A", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="top")
ax.text(B[0], B[1], "B", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(C[0], C[1], "C", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(D[0], D[1], "D", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(E[0], E[1], "E", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")

# Configure the plot
ax.set_xlim(-14965.77, 15034.23)
ax.set_ylim(-4965.77, 15034.23)
ax.set_aspect("equal")
ax.axis("off")

# Show the plot
plt.show()

ext_info.cot: The diagonal of the BDEC square is 18, so the length of the BC side is $\frac{18}{\sqrt{2}} = \frac{18}{1.41} = 12.77$. The BC radius of the ABC sector is 12.77 and the arc length is 23.13. So the CBA angle can be computed as $\frac{ArcLength}{2 \pi r} * 360 = \frac{23.13}{2 \pi * 12.77} * 360 = \frac{23.13}{80.2} * 360 = 0.29 * 360 = 104.4$. Therefore the final answer is 104.4.
